results.title: Nose and Tina
results.creator_credit: Norma Bailey, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Nose and Tina are two people in love. He works as a brakeman, she as a hooker. This documentary film captures the domestic details of their life together, and their problems with the law, work and money. Theirs is an unusual love story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norma Bailey, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Remarkable riderless runaway tricycle
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, John Sturner and Evergreen Productions
results.brief_description: A humorous fantasy about a little boy’s tricycle which is mistakenly picked up by garbage collectors and taken to the tip. However, the tricycle mysteriously takes on a personality and a will of its own, escapes from the tip and returns to its owner - but not before having aroused the suspicion of the garbage collectors and the police road patrol. Based on the book by Bruce McNillan.

results.title: Care: the wonder drug
results.creator_credit: Paul McCollough, William F Aull, MTI Teleprograms and S William Hinzman Films
results.brief_description: A dramatised case history of drug misuse by Jackie, a senior citizen. This films is designed to teach prescription and non-prescription drug users the consequences of not taking care with drugs.

results.title: The Normal neonate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Examination of a normal infant by a leading paediatrician. It encompasses the six stages of consciousness, the senses of sight and hearing, gross motor functions, and the primitive reflexes.

results.title: The Lion in the doorway
results.creator_credit: Prabhubodha Walker, Christina Ferguson, Macau Light Films and O J Productions
results.brief_description: A satirical, experimental, metaphysical western. A cowboy figure joins those of Icarus and Pierrot and encounters some less than lovely aspects of wild west culture.

results.title: Would you kiss a naked man? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: R. Alan Gough, Mary McLeod and Northern Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in sexuality”.
Demonstrates that sexuality and nudity are a natural part of an honest relationship between two people who care for one another by presenting a dramatized interlude between two teenagers in which they discuss the meaning of their relationship and engage in sexual play. From the series “Concepts in Sexuality”.

results.title: Gambling with our lives
results.brief_description: Modern technology provides us with an ever improving standard of living. However we are recognising the tradeoffs we must make between the benefits of progress against the potential hazards to our health. Research indicates that 85% of all cancer may be caused by environmental factors. This program looks into and discusses some of this research suggesting that we owe it to ourselves to learn more about the hazards of our modern world. Narrated by Norman Rose.

results.title: Five steps to conflict resolution (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Johnson, Dave Bell and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: Dr. William Glasser presents five steps to help teachers and administrators deal with personal, classroom, school-wide and community related conflict. When conflicts arise it is desirable to have an approach that will turn it in to a positive experience.
